title: Three railroad workers built a 'man cave' under New York's Grand Central Terminal
description: Three railroad employees were suspended without pay for converting a room underneath Grand Central Terminal in New York City into their own personal 'man cave.'

title: Sources: Trump intends to choose Amy Coney Barrett for Supreme Court
description: President Donald Trump intends to choose Amy Coney Barrett to be the new Supreme Court justice, according to multiple senior Republican sources with knowledge of the process.

title: Reboots and revivals of classic TV shows on the way
description: Some of your favorite nostalgic TV classics could be coming back to the small screen. CNN's Chloe Melas has more on some reboots and revivals on the way.

title: 25 people killed in military plane crash in eastern Ukraine
description: A Ukrainian Air Force transport aircraft crashed near the eastern city of Chuguev late Friday, killing 25 people, according to the country's general prosecutor's office.

title: Remembering a classic adult hotel playland
description: CNN's Holly Firfer travels back in time to the Holiday Inn Holidome

title: She won't vote for Biden, but fears second Trump term
description: CNN's Jeff Zeleny speaks to voters in Wisconsin, where President Donald Trump won by less than one percentage point in 2016, about the upcoming 2020 presidential election as some consider flipping to Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden.

title: Police officer shot dead in London as man is detained
description: A police officer has died after being shot in the early hours of Friday by a man being detained at Croydon Custody Centre in south London, the city's Metropolitan Police Service said.

title: See the tapes that could unravel a controversial mine project
description: Watch the secret recordings taken by environmentalist watchdogs posing as potential investors that could unravel a controversial mining project in Alaska. CNN's Bill Weir reports.

title: Selena Gomez is proud to show her transplant scar
description: Selena Gomez is feeling confident and proud, and is showing the world her kidney transplant scar, three years after receiving a new organ from her best friend.

title: Two injured in Paris knife attack near Charlie Hebdo's former office
description: Four people were injured in a knife attack Friday near the former offices of French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo, the site of a 2015 terrorist attack, authorities said.

title: How China's Ant Group built a $17 trillion payments machine
description: Ant Group is named after a tiny bug, but the company is huge in China, where its digital payments app Alipay is a daily necessity for hundreds of millions of users.

title: CNN's Brianna Keilar responds to White House attack
description: The White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany baselessly linked CNN reporter Brianna Keilar's comments about the Kentucky Attorney General to the shooting of two Louisville police officers after the killing of  Breonna Taylor. Hear her response.

title: See 'man cave' discovered under Grand Central Terminal
description: Three railroad employees were suspended without pay for converting a room underneath Grand Central Terminal in New York City into their own personal "man cave."

title: See how Ruth Bader Ginsburg's trainer honored her
description: Bryant Johnson, who trained Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg for over 20 years, did push-ups at her memorial in the US Capitol.

title: Trump has lost patience with CDC head after series of mixed messages
Pentagon is adamant it will not play a role in settling election disputes
Radiation on moon's surface measured for the first time, study says
description: When the next astronaut to reach the moon walks on the lunar surface in 2024, she'll face radiation levels 200 times higher than on Earth.

title: Pentagon insists it won't help settle election disputes
description: • Analysis: The FBI director just totally shut down Trump's vote-fraud conspiracy

title: Appellate judges skeptical of Trump's argument to block subpoena for financial records
description: A lawyer for President Donald Trump told a federal appeals court Friday that there is no request for documents that could be made as part of the Manhattan district attorney's investigation concerning hush-money payments issued during the 2016 presidential election that he wouldn't consider overbroad.

title: Tourist accused of defacing Rome's Colosseum
description: An Irish tourist has been accused of vandalizing Rome's Colosseum after security staff spotted him allegedly carving his initials into the ancient Italian structure.

title: Here's why platinum may now be a better bet than gold
description: Gold prices have soared more than 20% in 2020, and they hit a new record high earlier this year. Silver and palladium are surging, too. But platinum prices are down almost 15% year-to-date.

title: UK and France record most daily cases since start of pandemic, as university outbreaks linked to parties
Keith Hufnagel, skateboarding icon and streetwear founder, dies at 46
description: The world of skateboarding has lost an icon and entrepreneur with the death of Keith Hufnagel at the age of 46.

title: Meet 'Jaws of Death,' a 33-foot lizard that terrorized the seas 80 million years ago
description: Roughly 80 million years ago in the shallow inland sea that once split North America into eastern and western land masses, a fearsome 10-meter-long (33-foot-long) marine reptile with powerful jaws and tremendous bite-force was one of the apex predators.

title: 89-year-old pizza delivery driver gets $12,000 tip surprise from 'TikTok Family'
description: The tables quickly turned for an 89-year-old pizza delivery driver who received a surprise delivery of his own from "regulars" on his route -- a $12,000 tip.

title: State Department revoked award for journalist over social media posts critical of Trump and lied about it, watchdog finds
description: The State Department revoked a prestigious award from a Finnish journalist because of social media posts critical of President Donald Trump, according to a report from the State Department Office of Inspector General.

title: A British teenager staged a sit-in on an Arctic ice floe to protest climate change
description: A British teenager has staged a protest against climate change inside the Arctic Circle.

title: My brother Austin asked me to go to Syria with him. Four months later, he was taken.
description: I was at the beach with my family when my brother Austin called. His schedule at Georgetown Law School had prevented him from joining us. I slipped into an empty room at the little house we were renting and listened, astonished, as he told me he was planning a trip to Syria that summer of 2012, and he was asking me to come with him.

title: BMW fined $18 million
description: Luxury automaker BMW has agreed to pay an $18 million fine for misreporting its car sales figures over the course of five years, the Securities and Exchange Commission announced.

title: Lionel Messi aims a dig at Barcelona hierarchy after posting emotional farewell to Luis Suarez
description: It's safe to assume that Lionel Messi is still not happy with Barcelona's board.

title: Rafael Nadal is closing in on history. Can anyone stop him?
description: The tennis world waited seven months for the return of grand slams. Now, like buses, two have come along at once.

title: CNN takes a look inside the Portland protest movement
description: Protesters have been gathering in Portland for more than 100 days as part of an anti-police movement. Tensions between protesters and police have only escalated. CNN's Elle Reeve reports.

title: 'Hero rat' wins gold medal from UK charity for hunting landmines
description: A rat in Cambodia has been heralded a hero and awarded for saving lives.

title: Mandy Moore is expecting
description: Actress/singer Mandy Moore and her husband, musician Taylor Goldsmith, have something new to sing about.

title: Portrayals of trans people hide the tragic truth
description: In the recent Netflix documentary "Disclosure," clips of transgender television and movie characters flash up on screen in rapid succession. Again and again, we see similar images: murderers, sociopaths and sexual predators.

title: Kim Jong Un apologizes to Seoul for shooting of South Korean official
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has apologized for the death of a South Korean government worker who was shot dead by North Korean troops after crossing a maritime border between the two countries.

title: Mitch McConnell says there will be a transfer of power in US election
description: Senate majority leader Mitch McConnell assured a Fox News reporter that there will be a transfer of power to the winner of the 2020 US election after President Trump refused to commit to a peaceful transfer during a press conference. CNN's Abby Phillip reports.

title: SP Balasubrahmanyam, famed Indian film musician, dies from Covid 19 aged 74
description: One of India's most renowned film singers, SP Balasubrahmanyam, has died following hospitalization for Covid-19 and weeks spent on life support, the hospital treating him said in a bulletin Friday.

title: David Attenborough joined Instagram. Four hours later he had 1 million followers
description: Naturalist and TV host David Attenborough has claimed the record for shortest time to reach 1 million followers on Instagram, racking up the numbers just hours after joining the social media platform Thursday.

title: Lockdown find: Chinese wine vessel found in garage sells for $500K
description: A tiny teapot-shaped antique, discovered in a garage in England during a lockdown clear-out, sold for £390,000 ($497,000) Thursday, after its owner took it to an auctioneer for a free valuation.

title: This country has the world's worst youth unemployment. Is this the solution?
description: "I really count myself blessed to have a job right now," says Akhona Zondani.

title: The actor you never knew played Superman
description: Standing on the deck of a sinking Titanic, Kiran Shah prepared to jump. Fifty feet below, the water waited, cold and indifferent to the moment. It was another long, challenging night, but Shah was a professional; when the call came he did not hesitate.

title: Africa's CDC chief explains continent's low death rate
description: The Covid-19 death rate in Africa has defied expectations and stayed relatively low. CNN's David McKenzie speaks to Dr. John Nkengasong, Director of Africa's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, about the continent's coronavirus response.

title: 'Completely ridiculous': CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks Trump on health care
description: President Trump is touting what he calls his health care "vision," but the executive orders he's planning to sign largely punt on addressing major issues facing Americans. CNN's Daniel Dale has the facts.

title: The strange world inside North Korea's tourist hotels
description: For many travelers, spending a lot of time in a hotel means you haven't properly gone out and enjoyed a destination.
